alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 07 at 5:29PM MST until March 07 at 6:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MST FOR JUDITH BASIN AND CENTRAL CASCADE COUNTIES... At 527 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Stanford to 13 miles north of Wolf Creek, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Visibility down to a quarter mile or less could result in hazardous driving conditions. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 246 and 262. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 61. Highway 89 between mile markers 33 and 71, and between mile markers 72 and 89. Locations impacted include... Cascade, Stanford, Belt, Hobson, Geyser, Neihart, Raynesford, Windham, Moccasin, Monarch, Eden, Sluice Boxes State Park, Ackley Lake State Park, Sapphire Village, Stockett, Tracy, Utica, Centerville, Tower Rock State Park and Armington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
